formalDefinition: A homogeneous length function is a non-negative norm function ${\| \|: F_2 \rightarrow {\bf R}^+}$ that obeys the triangle inequality $$\displaystyle \| xy \| \leq \| x\| + \| y\| \ \ \ \ \ (1)$$ for all ${x,y \in F_2}$ , and the linear growth $$\displaystyle \| x^n \| = |n| \|x\| \ \ \ \ \ (2)$$ for all ${x \in F_2}$ and ${n \in {\bf Z}}$ , and such that ${\|x\| > 0}$ for all non-identity ${x \in F_2}$.
